metadata.title: CVE-2020-22015 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in FFmpeg 4.2 in mov_write_video_tag due to the out of bounds in libavformat/movenc.c, which could let a remote malicious user obtain sensitive information, cause a Denial of Service, or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-22015` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavformat58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libavutil56 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libswresample3 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libswscale5 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required
